title: Module Migration
description: Convert this CommonJS module to ES Module syntax. The module exports a Calculator class with add and subtract methods.

testCases.description: Has default export for Calculator class
Has named export for multiply function

hints.text: Use 'export default ClassName' for the main export and 'export function name()' for named exports
You can either add 'export' before the function definition or use 'export { multiply }' at the end

commonMistakes.consequence: ES Modules use export/export default syntax, not module.exports
commonMistakes.correction: Replace 'module.exports = X' with 'export default X' and 'module.exports.y = y' with 'export { y }'

commonMistakes.consequence: Functions and classes are not accessible outside the module
commonMistakes.correction: Add 'export' before function/class or use 'export { name }' at the end
